page.title: 06Mixed Farming
page.content: {Fleet Lane Farm}is near{Bredon.}The total area is{45 hectares}and the type of farming is{mixed.}Crops grown are {wheat}and barley. The grass is mown annually, 12 hectares are used for silage and 5.6 for hay.{Silage}is made because there is a better chance of producing a good crop. At present there are{63 beef {cattle,}a{Hereford}and{Friesian}cross; and{120 sheep}plus lambs. The animals are bought in the Autumn and sold in spring at{Gloucester Market. Three full-time and one part-time worker are employed on the farm. {Machinery}on the farm includes {tractors, diggers,}a{silage cutter}and {mowing machines.}The farm has one large barn which is used for cattle in the winter and two smaller barns for calves and sheep.
